activities:
We acquire, hold, use and process personal data about employees (including job applicants) for the performance and exercise of our responsibilities and rights under their employment contracts; workflow management, such as assigning, managing and administering projects; compensation, including stock plan administration and compensation analysis; performance management; succession planning; benefits and personnel administration, such as bonuses and pensions; IT helpdesk and support services; monitoring and enforcing compliance with company policies and procedures; reporting for government statistics; contract submissions; travel management; learning and development; hire, promotion, transfer, termination and other employment actions; complying with and exercising our rights under relevant employment laws and related legislation; and the general administration of our employer/employee relationships.

We acquire, hold, use and process personal data about customers for a variety of business purposes including to:  generally manage customer information; respond to questions and requests; provide access to certain areas and features of Eaton websites; verify customer identity; communicate about customer account and activities on Eaton websites and systems, and, in Eaton’s discretion, changes to any Eaton policy; tailor content, advertisements, and offers we serve to customers; send samples, premiums, products and information; process payment for products or services purchased; improve Eaton websites and systems; develop new products, processes and services; process applications and transactions; and for purposes disclosed at the time a customer provides personal data or otherwise with consent.  

We acquire, hold, use and process personal data about suppliers for a variety of business purposes including to:  generally manage supplier information; respond to questions and requests; provide access to certain areas and features of Eaton websites; verify supplier identity; communicate about supplier account and activities on Eaton websites and systems, and, in Eaton’s discretion, changes to any Eaton policy; tailor content; process payment for products or services purchased by Eaton; improve Eaton websites and systems; develop new products, processes and services; process applications and transactions; and for purposes disclosed at the time a supplier provides personal data or otherwise with consent.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
industrysector: General Industrial Eqpt & Supplies - (GIE)Electrical Power Systems - (ELP)Automotive Parts & Service Equipment - (APS)Construction Equipment - (CON)
personaldata: Employee Human Resources Data, Job Applicant Data, Customer Data, Supplier Data
privacyprograms: Eaton is not a member of any privacy program relevant to Safe Harbor.
recoursemech: Eaton elects to satisfy the requirements in points (a) and (c) of the Safe Harbor Enforcement Principle by committing to cooperate with the EU Data Protection Authorities or their authorized representatives, as well as the Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner in the investigation and resolution of complaints brought under the Safe Harbor and will comply with any advice given by the DPAs regarding specific actions required to comply with the Safe Harbor Principles.
